question: Fat is stored in the body in what form?

answers.option: Standing straight, both arms by the side and feet everted
Standing straight, both arms abducted, both feet together

question: What does vomiting lead to?

answers.option: Face facing forward, standing erect, arms folded, palms facing forward
Face facing forward, standing erect, arms adjacent to sides, palms facing forward

answers.option: Improve health and quality of life of urban dwellers

answers.option: A movement in which thumb touches the tips of fingers
A movement involving flexion of wrist
A special kind of movement involving circular motion of the thumb

question: The part of decidua which lies underneath the implanted embryo is termed as?

answers.option: To obtain nutrient in agar medium

answers.option: Accumulation of large lipid droplets within hepatocytes
Complete destruction of architecture of liver

question: Bacteria that are permanent residents in various parts of the body are known as normal flora. Which of the following statements best describes the colonization of the bacteria?

answers.option: This is the acquisition of new organisms
They inhibit pathogenic organism from binding to the epithelial surfaces

question: The normal flora inhibits pathogenic bacteria from binding to the mucosal surfaces of the body. Which of the following statements best describes the mechanism of colonization resistance?

answers.option: The resident bacteria occupy attachment sites on the mucosa
Intestinal bacteria provide vitamins B and K
Excessive use of antibiotics suppress normal flora
Malnourished patients develop vitamin deficiencies due to reduced flora
Normal flora causes disease in immunocompromised patients

Fragments of both new and old strand are dispersed in daughter DNA
Two entirely new daughter DNA are formed

question: Which of the following is a function of the sodium-potassium pump in the cell membrane?

answers.option: Increasing electropositive character inside the cell
